isnone¶

Stoner.tools.isnone(iterator: Iterable | None) → bool[source]¶

Return True if input is None or an empty iterator, or an iterator of None.

Parameters:

iterator (None or Iterable)

Returns:

True if iterator is None, empty or full of None.
